intro: Elytranthe bibracteolata var. acuminatissima, commonly known as the sharp-pointed elytranthe, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family, characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and vibrant floral displays. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves that form a dense basal rosette, with small, clustered inflorescences that produce showy, bell-shaped flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often growing in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
